item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "He turned out the light and went into Jem's room. He would be there all night, and he would be there when Jem waked up in the morning." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It's not necessary to tell all you know. It's not ladylike -- in the second place, folks don't like to have someone around knowin' more than they do. It aggravates them. Your not gonna change any of them by talkin' right, they've got to want to learn themselves, and when they don't want to learn there's nothing you can do but keep your mouth shut or talk their language." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It's not time to worry yet" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee (To Kill a Mockingbird)
item.description: "There is one way in this country in which all men are created equal—there is one human institution that makes a pauper the equal of a Rockefeller, the stupid man the equal of an Einstein, and the ignorant man the equal of any college president. That institution, gentlemen, is the court." -- Harper Lee (To Kill a Mockingbird)

item.title: Krista add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description:
"Don’t talk like that, Dill,” said Aunt Alexandra. “It’s not becoming to a child. It’s – cynical.”
“I ain’t cynical, Miss Alexandra. Tellin’ the truth’s not cynical, is it?”
“The way you tell it, it is." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Krista add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka
